basics.name: Nicholas Fung
basics.label: ML Engineer and Data Scientist
basics.summary: ML Engineer and Data Scientist with a MASc from UofT and a BASc from UBC.

work.name: Riskfuel Analytics
work.summary: Riskfuel uses deep learning to replicate complex derivative pricers written by quants at banks, with the goal of providing accurate approximations at a fraction of the cost for the purpose of real-time trading and P&L calculations. I was responsible for developing end-to-end ML pipelines, including synthetic data generation, training, validation, and delivering models to clients.

work.name: Non-Invasive Surgical Innovations
work.summary: NISI develops non-invasive surgical robotics. I was responsible for implementing real-time video denoising, as well as researching Computer Vision techniques. I developed a prototype using the YOLO v3 algorithm to detect cancerous tumors.

work.name: Cheung Kong Property Holdings Limited
work.summary: CKPH is a multinational company that deals primarily with property development. I was responsible the quality assurance of the new employee attendance system as well as automating various manual tasks . Futher, I provided IT support for a large population of on and off-site staff, including system upgrades and debugging.

projects.name: Variational Autoencoders: A Hands-Off Approach to Volatility
projects.summary: A volatility surface is an important tool for pricing and hedging derivatives. It describes the market price of an option on an asset as a function of the option's strike price and maturity. Raw option data is collected and processed, then used to train a neural network which can be used to model observed volatility surfaces as well as generate synthetic surfaces for the purposes of risk management.

projects.name: Beating the Odds: Horse Racing in Hong Kong
projects.summary: Horse racing is a lucrative business in Hong Kong, with annual turnover reaching 305 bn HKD (39 bn USD) in 2022. While the outcomes of each race tend to be largely random, several million web pages were scraped to identify key predictors of winning horses. Although various models was fit, the original data was too high dimensional for meaningful predictions. Future work may include improved feature engineering and dimensionality reduction, improved modelling, and collecting more contextual non-tabularized data.

volunteer.summary: nwPlus organizes several collegiate hackathons, including nwHacks, one of the largest hackathons in the Pacific Northwest, with over 600+ attendees. I was the Logistics Coordinator and later the Treasurer for the university club.
